document_data.name: Sphinx
document_data.mainbody: '''Sphinxes''' were a race of intelligent, immortal [[magical beasts]]. It was said that they once held a vast kingdom given to them by the gods in an effort to teach mortals the way of truth. The sphinxes had their own methods, however, by teaching mortals to think for themselves with riddles and parables. Four common subraces of sphinx included the [[androsphinx]], [[criosphinx]], [[gynosphinx]], and [[hieracosphinx]].<ref>
document_data.Description: All sphinxes had [[lion|leonine]] bodies with great feathery wings.

Ecology.Language: Sphinxes spoke their own language as well as [[Common]] and [[Draconic language|Draconic]].

Types.Androsphinx:
{{main|Androsphinx}}
Androsphinxes were a male subrace of sphinx, with the body of male lions, masculine [[humanoid]] faces, and massive wings. They were physically powerful creatures with inherent [[magic]]al powers and a terrifying roar. While they tended to be short-tempered and terse, androsphinxes possessed good-natured ideals and always attempted to do the right thing.
Types.Other Types:
*[[Canisphinx]] — [[Jackal]]-headed, predatory sphinxes
*[[Criosphinx]] — Male [[ram]]-headed sphinxes with low intelligence and generally had the sole aim of finding a gynosphinx mate.
*[[Dracosphinx]] — Evil, a [[red dragon]]-headed sphinx that lived on bleak cliff sites.<ref>
*[[Hieracosphinx]] — Evil, savage and animal-intelligent [[hawk]]-headed sphinxes. 
*[[Luposphinx]] — [[Wolf]]-headed, forest-dwelling sphinxes{{Cite dragon/119/The Dragon's Bestiary: A walk through the woods|49-50}}
*[[Saurosphinx]] — Reptilian-faced, conversational sphinxes
